channel.title: Project Rozak
channel.description:
Hey guys, This is my development project, called project rozak, and before you think, whats a new guy here tying to post a development, i will tell you, i am mrnessie. I just wanted to take on a new name. Anyways, lets cut to the chase. I wont list features, i will screenshot them as i go.
New titlebox is decent: [img]http://i42.tinypic.com/k49ndh.png[/img]
UPDATES:
Adding a custom gambling system, not giving out much info Adding a better commands system. Adding multiple pvp areas for pkers. More to come.
Thanks, Rozak

item.title: Project Rozak
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

Yeah, write some filler in your thread. Just click the modify button, and make it look better designed with more detail. But always keep your thread updated with posts like that, saying: “Hey, I’m going to be making this.” It notifies everyone that you’re currently working on something. You could also do it to where you have something on your thread in a certain color showing that it’s currently being worked on. Just make your thread look nice, and filled in, then people will start to take it more seriously. The more effort you put into your thread, the more people will start to support it, really. It shows dedication.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Rozak
item.dc:creator: @Rozak Rozak
item.description:
@Rozak wrote:

Ahh, thanks for the feedback man. I’m now trying to figure out how to add a worldswitching button. Can’t find a tut. Annoyed xD. and my goals are basically to create a oldschool server with some cool features

Read full topic

item.title: Project Rozak
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

Nobody ever thinks, “hey, who’s this new guy trying to make a project in a community that we support doing so?” You should provide more information about your server. Like your goals, update log, basic information about the server, just more stuff to fill up your thread. Your project would be taken more seriously this way, and you need a new layout. Not many pictures is fine, in the beginning, but you can’t forget to continuously update your pictures. Keep updated news and information in your replies, because not everyone re-reads the thread to check if you’ve made an update. Just some tips, constructive criticism - whatever.

@OP:
I like the titlebox, it could use some work - but overall, I like it. Hope to see this moving along. I’ve noticed that there’s been no replies to this, so I wanted to get it started.

Read full topic
